review_title: Great Community and researchers, Bad benefits
job_title: Researcher, PhD Candidate in Toledo, OH
pros:
These are specific to my graduate program/track
+Great in-house professors that focus on education
+Department-wide collaborations are common 
+Fun department events
cons:
These are general complaints for all college of medicine graduate students: 
-Tuition is covered, but still charge you almost $2000/year in "graduate student fees". The first of these charges is $1000 that you MUST pay before you've gotten your first paycheck (This sounds like a pyramid scheme) 
-They do not provide medical insurance, but will require you to have it to be in the program. 
-Salary is $24,000 which is the NIH-mandated minimum salary for graduate students
*Basically the salary is enough for a one bedroom apartment and occasional recreation (because Toledo is cheap), but it certainly won't pay your college loans from undergrad or allow you to save money for your future.

review_title: There is some definite pros and cons. If you look just at my department, alot of cons... I'm in heart and vascular.
job_title: Registered Medical Assistant in Toledo, OH
pros: Pay is higher than similar jobs at other hospitals, being in a union gives peace of mind, they aren't as strict as others about certain things like checking your phone, they allow wearing a plain navy Tshirt instead of scrub top, free tuition at University of Toledo.
cons: Management has favorites and if you aren't part of that group, then you may be targeted. Management ignored my doctor's note restrictions and made me feel like I'd lose my job for having them. You WILL be expected to work in some of the other departments in the heart and vascular office. If you work in Vascular Surgery, you WILL be expected to room cardiothoracic surgery patients and WILL be expected to work in wound care, like you are their staff. Taking concerns up the management chain doesn't change anything. Health insurance is not very good unless you like a high deductible plan and paying for parking sucks.

pros: You are going to get a pay check. It is not going to be the greatest but it is something to get by. I advise to run as far and as fast as you can from this university. The only reason that I liked the University of Toledo was the students. Some of them work really hard. I saw many who would not get needed scholarships just because the scholarship committee was giving them to the people that they wanted. The ladies have friends and family that are more likely to get the scholarships. It is a very biased way to help only a few. In the department that I would work, there was discrimination. They do not say it directly, but their attitude and style show it clearly.
cons: You will be over worked and under paid. The people do not care for others. There is a mind-set of not wanting to change the way things are done.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Perrysburg, OH
pros: I enjoyed my time at The University of Toledo. As a visiting professor, I knew there were things going on that I did not know about, and that suited me just fine.
cons: Although I was not privy to most of the office politics and hostilities between faculty and administration, I could feel the tension in the air. Some of my colleagues told me they wish they had accepted jobs elsewhere. I received an email from a university psychiatrist offering to talk to me my first week on the job about morale at the school. I did notice that management didn't seem to know what it was doing. I was told I would be informed when my job was going to be advertised, but I never was. During the vetting of candidates, my chair asked why I didn't apply for the job, and I told her nobody told me. She told me there was a possibility for part-time or adjunct work, and she would let me know within a month. Of course, she never did.

review_title: The University of Toledo functions as a for-profit university, resulting in a poor experience for many.
pros: Interested in supporting S.T.E.M. disciplines
cons:
Does not empower employees to make decisions.
Funding and support is poor for faculty, graduate students, and undergraduates.

review_title: Decent place to work if you are happy with your position
pros:
- State pension
- Good benefits
- Competitive Salary
- Very clean
cons:
- Upper management was terrible
- Lazy workers
- High Turnover rate for some positions
- Slowest HR department ever, some positions took months before they even posted the position let alone interview for it.
- Getting a promotion is tough.
- Favoritism, if you were part of the "good ole boy" network you had it made, if not they didnt really care.

review_title: It's a nice place to work
pros: I have had a great experience working here.  Though I believe my salary is on the low side and the chance for advancement is non-existent, I like the people I work with and especially enjoy working with the students.
cons: The University of Toledo has gone through some major organizational changes as they merged the old Medical College of Ohio into The University of Toledo.  The Provost has changed three times since I started working here five years ago.  The President does tend to focus on the Health Science campus, where he was working prior to the merger, and is letting the Main Campus fall behind in faculty, programs and staff.  It's very frustrating trying to get someone to make a decision because many are afraid to speak their opinions.

pros:
Amazing benefits! 
Good people. 
Flexible hours.
cons:
Not such great salaries. I think because of the benefits. It somewhat makes up the difference. 

They also have a consulting firm that has been here a very long time and really has pushed some great employees out the door.  

Job security is never there. As long as you come in knowing that at any point your job could be abolished then you won't be surprised if it happens. 

Job advancement can be tough. There are a lot of opening but unless you have the right connections, chances are you won't even get a call.

review_title: Secretary in several positions for 13 years
pros:
Good benefits
Fair pay
My manager was open to my ideas
cons: We had a  Union which didn't help employees. I tried to advance and never could. They always told me it would be bad timing as it would put me at the bottom of the seniority list as I had hoped to advance to Administrative Secretary because that is the capacity I was serving my manager at the time. When I was bumped for the 3rd,4th,or 5th time (lost track) there were no positions available at the time so I took a voluntary lay off with a promise to be called back in two years. I was called a couple times but then when I interviewed I was turned down (did not know Publisher). After 2 years I never wanted to hear UTMC's name again. I also used to donate to UTMC on a regular basis...no more!

pros: Most coworkers were friendly on my unit, and they taught me when they could. The nurses on my unit worked hard and had good teamwork, but some units have lazy nurses, so it really depends on which floor you work on. The work expected of me was fair, pay was good (better if you work nights). Patients were good, overall a good learning experience, especially if you’re a current student.
cons: The nurses tended to be very clique-y and liked to gossip. They all got along, but coming from an outside perspective, I felt excluded at times. The unit manager was never involved- I only saw her once every week or two.

review_title: Great Experience builder, but bad administration
job_title: IT Student Worker in Toledo, OH
pros: I was subject to many different IT problems that you need to learn how to address. That being said, many of those issues could have been resolved with better architecture and client training.
cons: The administration does not value you outside of cheap labor. I took a $4 paycut at one point and when your entire means of school is reliant on your pay, it puts you in a tight spot. There are no benefits. You are basically the alternative to paying for full time employees.

pros: Great working with professors that care. Reasonable with the balancing act  that comes from class work and the job. Access to facilities and equipment was not a problem. If I needed help with teaching or research, the professors were easy to access and gave quick and reasonable feedback.
cons: Being a graduate assistant means that you have to work on the schedule of others. Sometimes your schedule can be unpredictable, but that's the nature of the type of job. Balancing work with school work, research projects, and university activities requires tremendous time management. If your time management skills are poor, do not go for being a graduate assistant.

review_title: UT is focused on students, has some talented faculty, and is typical of academia
pros: UT is small enough to allow innovation and flexibility.   You can be a big fish in a small pond.   The medical campus is fairly small and the buildings are connected by tunnels (good in the winter).
cons: The size of the university limits its federal funding, which in itself is limiting.  Typical of academia, faculty are motivated primarily by personal agenda and funding.  The primary focus of the university is the education of its students, which is great for them but not so wonderful if your focus is on research.

review_title: Large institution, small campus feeling; People matter
pros:
Upper management solicit and respect the opinion of the hall directors. Hall directors have autonomy to manage their staff and residence hall given some basic standards for everyone. Most of the time not all the upper management appear to be competent, hence, hall directors have a lot more say on addressing emerging situations. The position has a lot more perks than the basic salary.

I have a lot of respect for Dr. Jacobs. In the time he's taken over the university presidency, I've seen a slew of renovations and construction around campus making it more beautiful. His push to go green and put his money where his mouth is is admirable. Also, I like how he comes out in town hall meetings to face the university community and answer questions himself. He does not hide behind his subordinates. He is a visionary. Some people may not understand nor see why he makes the decisions he does, but the future of the university is at stake. He is good for the university of Toledo.
cons:
Majority of the upper management (in the department) do not appear to be competent nor care about their work, except for the hall directors' direct supervisor. 
If assigned to a problem building, the hall director almost always seem to have to do the work herself. One would expect upper management to show up in person and try and address problems. You feel so alone!

review_title: Hostile work environment: anti employee culture
pros: Help students from different socio economic backgrounds fulfill goal to learn and earn a degree
cons: Policies heavily favor management and not the rank and file. Unprofessional climate. Very clickish and territorial attitudes of administrative staff toward professional faculty. Employees are distrusting of the executive leadership. Too much strife between management and the union creates a level of tension and paranoia among faculty.  Very sexist and oppressive environment.

pros:
Good environment, 
good research facilities, 
Hard working students. You should find a good faculty in this university, then the road will be easy for you,
cons:
A little bit cold weather in winter but other months are great. finding job it will be more difficult by comparing your university to other universities, 
but if you work good and publish several articles before graduation, 
your future will be bright, but if you want to come in average university and research like an average person you will have difficulties for finding job

pros: Loved working in the ProMedica system due to no pediatric care actually with the University of Toledo.  Amazing retirement benefits, as they take 14% out of your paycheck and then MATCH that 14% therefore 28% of your pay is put into retirement.  It is amazing.
cons: Hated that we had to have our continuity clinic very far away from the hospital that we worked at daily just to be at the university to have some connection to the university since they employed us.  Poor evaluation, due process or care for residents. No way to request for ADA accommodations without the department going through hoops to get you the link needed for the accommodations.  Then fired me before my accommodations could be applied.

review_title: Fine place; typical bureaucratic issues plaguing speed of administrative action
pros: The campus has a nice environment; very pleasant on the eyes outside of the lengthy dreary weather spells.  The technology employed is strong and very current.  Affords a high level of flexibility in interests and plenty of networking opportunities.
cons: The student body varies in their level of competence.  The board has changed admissions process so hopefully this will improve.

review_title: UT has potential, but unlocking will be a painful process.
pros: Large, urban university with a steady stream of underprepared and prepared students from local high schools. Beautiful campus and fairly easy access from the interstate.
cons: Administration is out of touch and is paid too much for their contributions. Budget cuts and lack of resources are pushing the students away as the focus is in making a profit.

review_title: Found a new professional family driven with a vision.
pros:
Learning Ventures is the department which I have worked at and this department has only one aim i.e. to provide excellent technical support and academic support to the students who choose online classes.As a result of the effort few programs have been recognized by the US News best programs list.

Diverse cultural background of the employees always helps in understanding various problems and University always has been an amazing place to work.
cons: Pay Scale,Extreme Climate,Bad Attitude of few Professors,Frequent Layoffs

review_title: Physics REU - small but good program
pros:
- a lot of freedom with respect to the project you want to work on
- a lot of free time to explore the city during your summer stay
- professors and staff are very friendly
- housing provided was good
- very flexible about dates of attendance (within reason)
cons:
- some details were ambiguous (they did not provide bedding though it was implied they would)
- projects are not very in depth, but the participants are newcomers to the research field

review_title: I work at University of Toledo for almost seven years.
pros: I can learn new knowledge from numerous seminar. people are friendly in the department. There is no traffic jam in this city and living expense is low.
cons: The salary is low. There is no compensation for the additional work time. People can not take vacation time in the first year.

pros: Very good health insurance benefit and employees can use UT medical center with benefit and ohio public retirement plan. Workers are nice and cooperative.
cons: Relatively smaler core facilities than big university. If you are interested in human sample to do research, getting enough samples is difficult.

pros: UT is a very good place to work. You can get much improvement in your experience. There is very good work environment in UT.
cons: 1. The way UT management work is very slow. 2. The reputation of the university is low in the country, UT should improve it.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Toledo, OH
pros: Creative and productive research environment. Great mentors and opportunities for professional development. Friendly and cooperative personnel. High social and cultural values and safety.
cons: Recent funding issues leading to less student enrollment. Salary is average, not very attractive for some researchers. Sometimes, bureaucracy can be annoying and disappointing.

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Toledo, OH
pros: The university is centrally located in the center and has great facilities. Health care benefits are exclelent
cons: Pay is low for a required 4/4 teaching load. The administration is corrupt and they do things backwards. UT does not invest in retaining visiting professors. The administration also lacks a level of professional when it comes to communicating to faculty about renewal of contracts or lack there of.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Toledo, OH
pros: The job was basic and the co-workers were good to work with and helped one another.  It paid well, and people were laid back.
cons: We would be moved around a lot and there seemed to be so much time spent on trying to be cost-effective but it seemed to work to the opposite of the goal.  The management was poor.  Superiors looked down upon those below.

review_title: It's a fair place to work, but I believe there are better options out there.
pros: Competitive pay, Vacation after 1 year employment, Co-workers are team members and work well together, Health care benefits are exceptional.
cons: Union, no chance for advancement, lack of communication between management and employees, No acknowledgement for doing the right thing or treating patients with respect.

review_title: It was a positive experience with great people to work under.
pros: It is a great learning environment. The leadership in my department was unquestionably superb. I enjoyed my time working there.
cons: It can be disorganized at times. Sometimes things could have been made easier with better checklists since the same things are being done at the same time each year and it wasn't always easy to remember how it was done.

pros: As a faculty member I have  flexibility, autonomy, and the ability to weave in the content I believe is going to be value-added for the students in our college as well as a "value-add' for our institution.
cons: The downside of working at UT is similar to any public academic institution--budgets are being cut dramatically so the adage of "doing more with less" is common.

pros: Good place to work, my advisor is really supportive. He commends you for the work done. Nice people and beautiful campus
cons: Ranking wise not that great and only few professors have good grants. You have to be self motivated to do good.

pros: Program was offered for students to gain experience with patient care
cons: Unit Manager did not provide much guidance on work performed on the unit. I was unsure if they were happy with my work as a Nursing Assistant or if I was completing the job along with everything that was expected to me.

review_title: I am a research assistance in EE department for 3 years.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Toledo, OH
pros: Met a lot of colleagues who are friendly and helpful, learned a lot form my adviser. Gained concrete knowledge about EE and research.
cons: You may met a very pushing advisor, then your life will be miserable. Also the wages for EE department is not very high compared to other department.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Toledo, OH
pros: I got to know a lot of people. Specially the undergrad mechanical engineering students and helped them understand the lab materials and also learnt a lot of things myself.
cons: Sometimes I had to work more than I was supposed to do. Its not that I have a problem. rather I had to do some others' work.

pros: Retirement, benefits, great staff, caring doctors
cons: cultural diversity, human resources, management

review_title: It all depends on what job you have and where.
pros: Flexible Schedules, direct deposit, fun atmosphere and you can do your homework at the same time.
cons: You can only work 20 hours as a full time student. You start off really low. Some bosses wont work with you and your class schedule.

review_title: UT has given me the opportunity to grow in my career and will help me move on to bigger things.
job_title: Student Accounting Assistant in Toledo, OH
pros: As a student, the university works around your class schedule.
cons: Sometimes the work can be tedious and boring.

pros: Quick and easy process. Good people to work for. Gave the offer within 2 weeks. Are flexible with work schedules and empower employees.
cons: I do not really have any negatives about the university. They are pretty good in everything they do.

pros: Buildings are nice and faculty are welcoming.
cons:
Everything else. 
Funding for graduate students is never guaranteed, they don't pay any health benefits for grad employees. Management (Chairs, Deans) is a joke. Only out for themselves. 
The parking situation is horrid. The town itself is dangerous and very poorly kept.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Toledo, OH
pros: Beautiful grounds, lots of friendly faces. Its not too big, so you'll get a chance to know lots of people.
cons: Bureaucracy, few places could compete for top prize in inefficiency. Progress should be based on competency not the whims of a few people.

review_title: Very helpful for your skill training
pros: The best part of the teaching assistant is that you could learn a lot from the professor and they are willing to help.
cons: You do not make a lot of money in education

review_title: College Job. Management is kind and considerate.
pros: It is family-owned so everyone is laid back. The management is very considerate of everyone, especially the ones in college such as me.
cons: Some of the other employees are a bit annoying at times, and tease the other workers.

pros: Flexible schedule, good work environment, understanding boss. Its a very nice experience to work here. Learned a lot of things about good work environment.
cons: There are no cons,but it would be better if they increase their pay scale. Besides this I never had any problem or issues working here.

pros: great benefits (medical, dental, vision, retirement plan, tuition discount), ability to move between departments and climb the ladder, good pay, overtime available in most departments
cons: some areas have poor management, but nothing extreme.

job_title: International Recruitment Specialist in Toledo, OH
pros: Lots of support from colleagues and supervisors
cons: Expectation that students should be treated as customers (this is known to be a growing problem in higher education in general, not just at UT)

review_title: Great opportunity for an IT or CS major
job_title: IT Student Worker in Toledo, OH
pros: I had an awesome boss and the hours were flexible. I learned a great deal of skills in the IT field.
cons: The pay was minimum wage, as expected. There are many bosses you could work for, fortunately mine was a great guy.

pros: Very good place to work. People are really friendly towards new employees. Got full tution waiver with this position
cons: Education is on the downside. If you are low on your finances and you just need funding, you should choose this university

pros:
Good research opportunities,
Provides opportunities to develop as a student and extra-curricular activities including leadership and outreach.
Great guidance, support and mentoring.
cons:
Nothing major from the university of the Toledo (employer) side: Major downside is the weather. 
Hard to find other business and entrepreneurial opportunities after graduation.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Toledo, OH
pros: You have a lot to learn with smart people and you have a solid chance to take your career to a new level
cons: You can get overwhelmed with the work available but that wouldn't matter since you're learning with every opportunity that comes

pros: The school does not have many students. So there are not many students even in the undergrad classes. The working hours are also very hard to handle. Very flexible working time and not very hard tasks.
cons: Cannot think of any cons so far.

review_title: It was a great place to work part-time as a student.
job_title: Windows Consultant for Engineering College Computing in Toledo, OH
pros: Flexible scheduling, friendly supervisor, a variety of tasks to keep things interesting.
cons: Pay wasn't very high, sometimes you had to go with some strange policies that were handed down from the main leader of IT.

review_title: Decent institution to work for as a graduate assistant. Very flexible and pay is offered during winter/ spring break.
job_title: Graduate Teaching Associate in Toledo, OH
pros: Depending on the department there are opportunities for teaching experience if you are considering going into higher education.
cons: Some lack of communication between administrators, colleges, and departments.

review_title: Good place to live and work
pros: Good environment to establish a career in academia. New facilities. Excellent IT support.
cons: Laboratories need renovations and upgrades. Compensation is not competitive compared to other universities in the region, however other benefits as health insurance and retirement plan are relatively good.

pros:
-Great work environment
-Make great connections
-Tuition is paid for
-Earn money while earning your degree
-Make friends that will last a lifetime
cons: There really are not any cons to speak of. The university is a great place to be and takes good care of its employees.

review_title: Wonderful place to work, flexible, union position.
pros: Room for movement, union, pay, schedule, management
cons: There are some down sides to working union. Often left picking up slack from coworkers

pros:
With reasonable hard work, you get opportunity of funding 
All students researchers work well with each other
less red tape for students compared to others
cons: Facilities need improvement for better research

pros: Great place to work with a lot of expert advice and learning experiences always available from the senior management.
cons: There are none. If you are looking for a good education and good work experience at an affordable price look at UT.

pros: good research guidance and plenty of resources
cons: No good carrier options for masters graduate students. chair and dean aren't  friendly and unprofessional at times. No one will provide support or give permission to work on an internship.

review_title: Does not invest in staff development

pros: The College of Business and Innovation at The University of Toledo is amazing.  My colleagues are respectful, supportive, and appreciative of my efforts.  As a college, we are truly student-focused.
cons: I haven't found any downsides.

pros:
You have a very good team to help you out resolve the issues of faculty and students
Understanding Management

On time pay
cons: No bad experiences to tell

pros: great experience, nice people, average low work load

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Toledo, OH

review_title: UTMC has been a wonderful job experience, learned many skills and had many opportunities

pros: Quality research environment for a smaller institution
